benchmark_details.name: EvoCodeBench
benchmark_details.overview: EvoCodeBench is designed to evaluate Large Language Models (LLMs) in code generation, addressing limitations such as data leakage and lack of domain-specific evaluations. It includes evolving data updated regularly and domain-specific evaluations to help practitioners select superior LLMs.
benchmark_details.data_type: code generation tasks with requirements and code samples

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of EvoCodeBench is to evaluate LLMs in code generation across different domains, providing insights for practitioners and researchers.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: EvoCodeBench is currently monolingual (Python) and smaller in size compared to some existing benchmarks.

data.source: Collected from high-quality open-source Python repositories through an automatic pipeline.
data.annotation: Automatically generated with human evaluation for quality assurance.

methodology.calculation: Pass@k is calculated based on the number of correct programs out of generated programs that pass test cases; Recall@k measures the recall of reference dependencies in generated programs.
methodology.interpretation: Higher Pass@k and Recall@k scores indicate better performance in generating accurate solutions.
methodology.baseline_results: For example, the highest Pass@1 of gpt-4 on EvoCodeBench-2403 is 20.74%.
methodology.validation: The benchmarks' integrity and performance were validated through extensive experiments with various LLMs.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data is collected from public open-source repositories; no personal data is included.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: EvoCodeBench is available under a CC-4.0 license.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Only high-quality open-source repositories are used, ensuring compliance with legal standards.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: The dataset adheres to open-source licensing guidelines.
